name: Ultra-Blur Talc-Free Waterproof Translucent Pressed Setting Powder
about: What it is:An ultra-blurring, finely milled, talc-free pressed powder, infused with hyaluronic acid, that delivers up to 16 hours of comfortable wear and shine absorption..Coverage:Light.Finish:Matte.Formulation:Pressed Powder.Highlighted Ingredients:- Amino Acid and Silica Powders: Create a soft-focus effect on fine lines, pores, and imperfections..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance..What Else You Need to Know:Achieve a natural-looking, soft-matte finish with this pressed powder. Infused with hyaluronic acid, amino acids, and silica powders, it blurs fine lines, pores, and imperfections while providing comfortable, non-drying, cake-free wear. Itu2019s also crease-resistant, waterproof, and sweatproof and has no photo flashback or white cast..Clinical Results:In a 3-week consumer test with 30 women:
ingredients: -Amino Acid and Silica Powders: Create a soft-focus effect on fine lines, pores, and imperfections..-Hyaluronic Acid: Makes the powder feel comfortable on all skin types, even dry skin..-White Lilly: Prevents oxidation and photo flashback...Mica, Aluminum Starch Octenylsuccinate, Lauroyl Lysine, Silica, Zinc Stearate, Diisostearyl Malate, Octyldodecyl Myristate, Magnesium Myristate, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Bran Wax, C13-15 Alkane, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Lilium Candidum Flower Extract, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sorbic Acid, Tocopherol, Sodium Hyaluronate. +/- (May Contain/Peut Contenir) Iron Oxides (CI 77492, CI 77491, CI 77499), Blue 1 Lake (CI 42090), Manganese Violet (CI 77742), Red 7 (CI 15850), Ultramarines (CI 77007), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Using the included applicator, pick up product, then tap off excess..-Gently press onto skin to set makeup. .-Roll onto areas where cream products have been applied, pores are visible, or excess shine appears..-Use to set makeup at home or blur skin on the go..-Follow with color products...Pro tip:.-Check application by touching your cheek. The area should feel smooth. If it feels tacky, more powder is needed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, gray hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm in my 60s and have used many types of powders over the years. This is the absolute best of them in my opinion, but it's not a powder meant to add another layer of makeup for  additional coverage (as an example). It is smooth and light with a diffusing quality that blurs pores and small imperfections. It is mattifying, but not so much that it makes my dry skin look dryer or emphasizes any texture. Because I start with an illuminating sunscreen (Supergoop! Glowscreen for the win!) like to use it on my t-zone, on any puffiness under my eyes, and around my lips before lipstick. In fact, I like it so much that I bought a second one for my purse.

reviews.review_text: There is a very subtle color to this powder, but it worked well with my fair skin. Unfortunately it was a little clingy to my dry patches. First off, the packaging is lovely and feels super sturdy. I havenu2019t thrown it in my bag, but feel like it would totally stand up to the chaos in there. The little powder brush isnu2019t great, itu2019s just like any youu2019ll find in a compact, but I imagine it would do the job for quick touch ups. I am unfortunately plagued with super dry skin, so powder is always nerve-wracking for me. This powder is veryyy velvety, soft, and lovely, but it still stuck to dry patches during my normal routine. The staying power was good, but I just hate feeling like you can see powder on my face. Maybe with a different prep it would work better, and I imagine it would be AMAZING on more normal/combo skin types, but Iu2019ll have to keep looking.

reviews.review_text: So, I tested this product over a couple of weeks, and I like it! You get a compact case with a pressed powder, a puffer, and a mirror. The powder came in a Translucent shade, which worked perfectly for my light skin tone. It has a light powdery clean scent that fades pretty quickly on my skin. It helps my makeup to stay longer and slow down skin oil production. It makes my skin feel soft and really smooth to the touch, but visually it doesn't really blur much, you need to apply a decent amount of product. My initial concern related to this was that the product could oxidize on my face by the end of the day, but it didn't happen. Overall, it's a nice pick if you would like to renew your layer of powder on the go, but for initial application at home, I would prefer a loose powder.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this pressed powder! I already had the ultra blur lose powder and used it daily. This is great because itu2019s compact and I prefer pressing the powder into the skin. It has a mirror, and a puff, and you can just throw it in your bag! LM already doesnu2019t miss when it comes to setting your makeup and this is just an extension of that excellence. I have since switched from using the lose powder as much to carrying this with me because of the convenience! I highly recommend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve used this powder for the past couple of weeks. I have combination/oily skin. I have dry under eyes, and this wasnu2019t bad at setting my concealer but over time it looked less u201cblurredu201d. It settled into my dry under eye lines. It did a decent job at keeping my makeup in place but it didnu2019t hold all day (6-8 hours). Feels lightweight on the skin and does set easily, which I liked. I like that thereu2019s added skin care ingredients. It will probably work well for some people, just wasnu2019t for me. For the price, I expected better.

reviews.review_title: Great for setting makeup on the go!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It had been a while since I had last used Laura Mercier translucent powder but I remember liking it. I am so pleased to say that I LOVE the pressed powder version of it! It gives the most beautiful sheen to skin that isnu2019t completely matte but doesnu2019t make me look shiny either. It doesnu2019t settle into fine lines or pores, it just kind of blurs everything. My makeup doesnu2019t budge with this which is a huge deal in the climate that I live in. I love this powder and that it is refillable and easy to take on the go. In fact, itu2019s inspired me to revisit the loose powder as well!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love this lightweight formula. It leaves my skin looking matte and feeling very soft and makes my makeup look flawless the whole day. I will continue to use this in my daily routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was searching for a pressed powder I felt good about using. On application, this powder effortlessly melts into my complexion without emphasizing any dry patches or settling into fine lines. The lightweight formula feels airy and comfortable, perfect for all-day wear. This setting powders blurring effect... It's like having a real-life filter for your skin. Pores where!!?? Despite its blurring prowess, I was initially skeptical about its oil-controlling abilities. But boy, was I pleasantly surprised! Even on my oily skin, this powder managed to keep shine at bay throughout the day, without making my complexion look flat or cakey. It strikes the perfect balance of matte without veering into the dreaded overly powdery territory.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin

I was excited to sample this product as Laura Mercier is the holy grail of setting powders but this one kind of fell short of my expectations. My first impressions were the box it comes in is sleek and looks high-end but the compact itself feels like cheap plastic. I like that it has a mirror and separate compartment for the puff but for the price I think they couldu2019ve done better with the compact. The color honey seemed a bit too yellow for my skin tone but I think the translucent shade wouldu2019ve been too fair for me. The texture of the product was smooth and I do think it works just not sure itu2019s worth the price point.

reviews.review_text: I noticed no difference after application. It claimed to blur the look of skin, and it did not blur my pores and acne scars.  It did matte my skin after foundation application.  This powder hid nothing.  If you want any type of coverage, this is not the product for you.  The packaging was great, and I loved that it had a separate compartment for the applicator.  It also has a nice, clean smell.

reviews.review_title: Never knew I was missing outu2026.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product in Translucent, which is a first for me, as I usually try to match my skin tone with any powder products (one exception being Hudau2019s pink cherry blossom shade of loose bake powder). I have tried Laura Mercier foundation in the past and LOVED the Silk Photo Oil Free offering, and assumed her products were all as high quality. This surpasses that. The packaging is wonderful, although I tend to use a brush for all u201cbase productu201d and powder application, there is a round sponge kept underneath the product in a separate u201ctrayu201d, which is ideal for a variety of reasons. I shy away from pressed powders because they often look unnatural, crease, cake, or otherwise donu2019t wear well or wear well for very long. This is the beauty of the translucent shade, and just this formula. Itu2019s light, but perfects. Not heavy, but creates a flawless look. Versatile in that I can apply it with a brush or sponge, and lasts. I have applied it to my lids, which is highly recommended under shadow for a nice smooth application/staying power, or over a u201cnakedu201d lid, color corrected with some concealer. Where is really u201cshinesu201d is under the eye, which is typically not a place Iu2019d DREAM of applying any powder, let alone a pressed one. It sits beautifully, no creasing. I can really blush, highlighter over the powder as needed, no problems. I can reapply this powder, no dreaded u201clayer looku201d. Iu2019m a believer!

reviews.review_title: Wow! This is a good powder
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Wow! I put this on at 9am and at 10:30pm, my face was still matte! Liking it the most on my t zone because of the blurred soft focus finish. Wearing great under my dry under eyes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been obsessed with Laura Mercier setting powder forever and when they came out with the Ultra Blur Loose Setting version, I knew I had to snag it. No surprise, I totally fell in love with it and it became my holy grail setting powder. So, naturally, I was pretty hyped to hear about their new pressed version of my favorite Setting Powder.   The powder is very finely milled and feels smoother than the loose powder, likely due to it being pressed. There is a faint, slightly unpleasant odor upon opening the compact, but itu2019s not a dealbreaker for me.  The pressed powder applies beautifully and provides a nice blurring effect, just like the loose version. However, it is much more mattifying. My skin is combo/oily, so I definitely like a mattifying powder. But this one can be a bit much and a little over drying, especially in the under eye area. It unfortunately creates the appearance of fine lines where there weren't any before. So Iu2019ve been avoiding my under eyes and stick to the rest of my face. Normally, I blot my T-zone at least once a day, but with this powder, I rarely have to.   I found using a flat top brush works way better than the applicator that comes with it for applying the product.   If you have oily skin, this powder is definitely worth considering. However, if you have dry skin or concerns about under eye dryness, you might be better off with the loose version.  I received this product for free in exchange for writing a review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Laura Mercier has always been u201cthat girlu201d when it comes to setting powders. I am grateful to have received this from Laura Mercier to try and review. After two weeks, here are my results!   Firstly the compact feels great in my hand and the shade I received was MEDIUM DEEP.  Longevity: This powder can endure through the long haul. It wasnu2019t too cold or too hot so I cant speak toward extreme climate, but for a 8 hour workday! You are set!   Color Match: There are three shade but I found that with my Deep, Warm face shade, my color was a tad bit light. The range offered was suitable for someone a bit lighter. For reference, I put a side by side of my current face powder from Laura Mercier.  Coverage: Similar to what you would expect from Laura Mercier cult classic! No let downs! Makeup application is key and user error is sometimes the main contributor!  Cons: The blurring effect! Seriously, the last time is used a powder with similar effect was with Tartes u201cSmooth Operatoru201d. Of course, I had to fight with Tartes white cast but as far as the smoothness, it reminded me of that!   I wasnu2019t able to test the waterproof claim, prior to my review, however I donu2019t plan to run a marathon. The waterproof aspect doesnu2019t appeal to me, I just want it to look good and last until Iu2019m ready to wash it all away!   All in all, Laura Mercier, never miss!

reviews.review_text: Talc-Free & Waterproofu2764ufe0f I live in Colorado and itu2019s a pretty dry climate.  Iu2019m in my 40u2019s and have combo skin-winter is particularly harsh on my skin. I usually use setting spray instead of powder because it has worked better with my cream based makeup. Iu2019ve used this product the last two weeks in place of my spray.  The good:   Awesome stay power-we had a crazy snow storm here and I was outside clearing snow of my truck and shoveling a path. Hair-Ruined, Makeup-still in tact ud83eudd23  Application: smooth and silky. I used both the included applicator and a brush and liked both.   Removal-easy for being waterproof. No issues taking it off with my normal makeup remover.   The bad:  Not really much to say here. No complaints.

Thereu2019s a slightly sweet smell and the powder does its job in concealing pores and absorbing oil. It is long lasting for someone who tends to have oiler skin. Iu2019m happy to use it but itu2019s not something Iu2019d seek out or put at the top of my must-have list. I tend to prefer more of a glow and this gives a matte finish.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wonderful! Light, soft blurring, matte finish. Non-drying but absorbs shine. Very nice finish for a fresh face.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I liked this! I honestly prefer the lose power better but this is so nice to have to take with you for touch ups! I do admit, it has a bit of a smell, but nothing awful. I would recommend! The translucent works great for fair skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have used many different pressing powders but this one does what it says it does! Definitely blurring and makes my skin look super smooth/soft. highly recommend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love how thereu2019s no flashback or white cast on my deeper skin tone when using this product. I also like how blurring it is.

I've been using the Laura Mercier loose setting powder religiously for the past 2 years and this is my first time trying the pressed setting powder. It achieves just the same look except the application is 100% easier! I can carry it around easily in smaller bags without having to whip out the loose powder jar and brush.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Compared to loose powder, this pressed powder is so convenient. You don't have to worry about powder flying when you use it. I have oily skin. My face becomes oily after a few hours in the morning. This loose powder can be carried with me to touch up my makeup. It's my favorite

reviews.review_title: New staple product in my routine

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Itu2019s not worth the 52 dollars plus it doesnu2019t even last half a day

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Great setting powder! Not as messy as the loose powder. Great for touch ups on the go!!  I received this product free in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: So good! Makes my makeup stay in place all day long and doesnu2019t look cakey at all! Also comes with a little puff to apply it with! My new holy grail powder!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This was such a great product for blurring pores. It doesnu2019t feel heavy and lasts all day. Make sure to use a good setting spray.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin

reviews.review_title: Prefer loose powder, but formula is good

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The honey shade blends in really well on my medium tan/ dark skin tone.  Itu2019s not cakey and blends well just like the loose setting powder.  Laura Mercier has always been my holy grail setting powder and now this pressed version makes it very convenient for on the go makeup application.  Brown girl/flash photography approved!!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product for free from Influenster and Laura Mercier for my honest review. The compact is very nice for travel because you have a mirror, the product, and a puff to apply the powder. The compact plastic feels cheap, but it does not look cheap from faraway. I like the puff compartment has holes to allow the puff to breathe and airout. The product looks yellow when I opened it and was a bit worried it would be too yellow on the skin. It does melt into the skin quite quickly and the yellow blends in beautifully and it is not noticeable, there is no whitecast. There is no scent. It does apply smoothly and melts into the skin using the puff. I tried a brush and I prefer the included puff. It does a decent job on my pores but I think my holy grail powder from Huda does a better job on the pores. This also started to look cakey on my chin and nose area as the oils started to come to the surface. It also slightly irritates my skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: After using this products for a couple weeks I have completely updated my makeup routine. This powder is so beautiful and easy to use. Perfect for quick touch ups as well as a long routine. Blurred out imperfections and kept my makeup flawless.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product in exchange for an honest review, but I already know that as soon as I run out, Iu2019m going to buy another one. The powder set my makeup incredibly well. It didnu2019t budge at all. I also switched to glasses halfway through my day and there wasnu2019t any transfer of the powder onto my glasses at all. It was genuinely so nice and it helped cover all my redness. I couldnu2019t possibly recommend it more! Itu2019s definitely going to be a staple in my makeup routine now!! I included two pics, one of me that morning looking really rough, and one of me after my regular makeup routine plus the powder!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Since having used this sitting powder  for a few days I can say that I had different expectations for it, I have combination skin and I usually use skin care that controls excess oil. That being said, the first time I used it it left me dry skin, I decided to change my moisturizer for one for dry skin and only then did I feel that it worked well because it did not leave my skin dry, in my opinion I would not buy it again!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin

I love how my pores disappear with a just a light dusting. I have dry skin and havenu2019t noticed any over drying with the use of this powder. Beautiful coverage.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product is great ok my sensitive skin and it leaves a beautiful matte finish to my makeup. Also great for any touch ups on the go. Leaves my face looking as if I just did my makeup for hours. Long lasting and beautiful finish.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, black hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Lasted getting caught in the rain at work and chasing after toddlers all day! Set cream makeup and seemed to blurr my undereyes(set there with a puff and set remainder of face lightly with a brush)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin

reviews.review_title: A truly ultra-blurring powder great for combo skin

reviews.review_text: I have oily-combination skin and looooove this powder to keep the shine away. I have tan skin and the honey color blends perfectly! I do prefer using a big fluffy brush for better control (you can layer and add more powder as needed) versus the flat puff in the compact. There is a light fragrance to the powder, but I loved that!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product in return for an honest review and have been using it for a couple of weeks now and I am loving it! It sets well despite my dry skin and stays looking great until I wash everything off. It has done a great job minimizing my visible pores. If you like a matte finish that works well this is worth a buy. I will definitely be adding this to my regular use.

reviews.review_title: A must have in my routine
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This translucent setting powder is very nice. There could be more product for the price but it comes in a nice little compact. It has came in handy when I'm on the go and my face gets a little oily. It's not loose so it's not getting everywhere, comes with a nice little cloth applicator and worked wonders for blurring. I received this product free from bzzagent for test and review purposes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve only tried this product twice, once was a small travel size and this bigger size. Itu2019s very good for setting my concealer and I can use it for baking my highlighter parts.   This is a pricier item so I use every single bit in the pot. It does absorb my oils pretty well but I do see it settling in my lines.  I have not checked if it leaves a white cast yet but I will let you know if it does. Overall I enjoy this product

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product isnu2019t for the oily girls! While it may set my makeup, it doesnu2019t offer any mattifying nor does it really set itself apart from the other products on the market. The first few times I used it- I used it with the puff it comes with, my own puff, a sponge & a brush. None of them seemed to be right as it did set my makeup but by the time Iu2019d driven 20 minutes to work, it looked like I hadnu2019t put on anything at all. I love that itu2019s a portable option but thatu2019s about it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my first time using this powder and I love how lightweight it is. It doesn't leave my face looking ashy either like some powders tend to. The color blends so well with my complexion. I also really like the packaging packaging and that the applicator is in its own compartment.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product on exchange for a honest review. The Laura Mercier Translucent Medium Deep Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur is a standout among setting powders. It not only sets makeup flawlessly but also smooths and blurs skin, especially nicely on my deeper skin tone, without drying it out. Its lightweight formula has proven to be long-lasting wear without feeling heavy or cakey. This powder holds up very well over time, and maintains its blurring effect for hours. I would definitely purchase it and highly recommend it to others, especially those with deeper skin tones seeking a reliable setting powder.

reviews.review_title: Effective but Not My Favorite Choice
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: As an avid makeup enthusiast, I recently had the opportunity to try out the Laura Mercier Ultra-Blur Talc-Free Waterproof Translucent Pressed Setting Powder, and unfortunately, it didn't quite meet my expectations.  While I can acknowledge that the product does deliver on its promises in terms of setting makeup and providing a matte finish, I found myself not particularly impressed with certain aspects of it. Firstly, the scent was not to my liking. I prefer my makeup products to either have a subtle fragrance or be completely fragrance-free, and the scent of this powder was a bit overpowering for my taste.  Additionally, I wasn't a fan of the included powder puff. It felt a bit rough on my skin, and I found it didn't distribute the product evenly or smoothly. As someone who values a seamless application process, this was a bit disappointing.  Comparing it to the Laura Mercier Translucent Loose Setting Powder, which I've been a fan of for quite some time, I personally still favor the loose powder over the pressed version.  Overall, while the Laura Mercier Ultra-Blur Pressed Setting Powder does work effectively as a setting powder, its scent and the quality of the included powder puff left me feeling less enthusiastic about incorporating it into my makeup routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product in exchange for my honest review. When I say this powder does not move I mean it. Iu2019ve been testing this powder for a few weeks now and have not been dissatisfied. I donu2019t use the powder puff it comes with. Instead I lightly tap it on with a fluffy brush for an airbrushed finished. You can absolutely bake with this powder I just choose not to. I have tan skin and the honey pressed powder looks so good and brightening. I have an oily t zone and this keeps me smooth and oil free all day. LA weather is now warmer and I have not felt the need to touch up my makeup. My concealer also does not cake up or crease unnecessarily when I use this powder on top. This powder is lightweight and has a very faint fragrance. The packaging is compact but I will say although I love the beige color I know it might not stay clean.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love this pressed powder. I have dry skin and it worked well setting my concealer and blurring pores without looking dry. It come with a powder puff so itu2019s perfect for travel. I will definitely repurchase when Iu2019m out. I was gifted this product in exchange for my honest review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wow! Iu2019m extremely surprised at how well this powder works. Iu2019m happy to say that it creates a lock on my makeup through the day and is truly waterproof. After snowboarding all day my makeup was still in tact. I definitely recommend for combination skin and oily skin because it does itu2019s job as well as does not clog pores.

reviews.review_title: Must try for a setting powder

reviews.review_text: I have noticeable pores and redness, but this translucent powder effectively conceals them. I highly recommend it; it gives my makeup a flawless finish, controls oil, and provides a smooth matte appearance for hours. I prefer applying it with a brush over a powder puff, and it works wonderfully for me!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this power for about a month now daily and I love the matte finish and my skin looks pore less. I love how it doesnu2019t break apart  like the other powders I have used if the past

reviews.review_title: Gives a gorgeous finish to skin!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this item from Laura Mercier in exchange for my honest review. I have been using it for a few weeks now and I think it is great! reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is a great setting powder!Now my makeup last all day long.I don't even see it on my skin, but is there making my skin perfect.It covers all the imperfections!Love it!

reviews.review_title: A high quality long lasting matte setting powder

reviews.review_text: I am SO impressed with the Laura Mercier Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur! It gives my skin a flawless, airbrushed finish and really helps to blur any imperfections. I have used the Laura Mercier Loose Setting Powder many times in the past and this product provides the same great results without all of the mess. I highly recommend this setting powder to anyone looking for a high-quality long lasting matte setting powder. I received this product from BzzAgent in exchange for my honest review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: So far has been really helpful with blurring pores in my T zone, and smoothing out under eye lines. Will be interested to see how it holds up in the summer months

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin

Felt like it was softer than the fenty one I have , very smooth and only a little needed to smooth out any crease areas , thank you to Laura Mercier for sending me this ultra blur translucent setting powder via BzzAgent , I will be keeping this in my go bag for daily use!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After trying this product I found that it didnu2019t have as much coverage as I would have liked it to have. If you like a sheer, light product then I would say this is for you. Maybe it was the shade that didnu2019t match, but it didnu2019t work well with the rest of my make up and I noticed a change in the over all color once it was on my skin. It will say it does blur at the beginning, but as time goes by I start to notice texture. It just simply was not for me, but I am willing to give it a second chance in a different shade.

reviews.review_title: Setting powder necessary for on-the go
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was very impressed by this translucent setting powder. The sleek all in one compact made it very easy for me to bring this setting powder on the go for touch ups throughout the day. The setting powder kept my makeup looking flawless throughout the day without feeling greasy/oily or looking shiny as the hours went on, but at the same time did not make my skin dry out. This product is great if you are looking for a matte finish. I very much enjoyed this product and look forward to incorporating it into my daily routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This powder looks nice and feels good but I donu2019t really like how it is when itu2019s used. To start it has a smell and while I donu2019t mind scented skincare and makeup this smell isnu2019t the best. And if you have drier skin I wouldnu2019t recommend this powder over others. I feel like it amplified my dry spots.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have very fair, normal to dry skin. Iu2019ve been trying the Ultra-Blur Talc-Free Waterproof Translucent Pressed Setting Powder for a few weeks now, and while I donu2019t know that I have the targeted skin type, I can see how some would really love it.   I didnu2019t notice much of a blurring effect, but it does a great job of setting my makeup into place all day. I did feel this powder was too drying for use under my eyes. I currently use the Charlotte Tilbury which seems to be smoother and more finely milled. Iu2019m not usually one to touch up throughout the day, but I found myself pulling this out to do just that! The compact is beautiful and makes it very convenient for on the go. I will probably end up keeping this in my bag for random touch ups and keep searching for a replacement for the Dior powder no powder that is a bit more soft and blurring on the skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: After using this product, Iu2019m pleased to say itu2019s top notch! I used it to set my foundation and concealer. It blended beautifully and made my makeup last all day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The packaging for this product is larger than I expected! The blurring effect makes me look pore less and doesnu2019t budge.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As a 40 year old, my favorite makeup items are those that blur fine lines and large pores, and this does the trick! I donu2019t love a heavy makeup look. (I wear tinted sunscreen or tinted serum daily rather than foundation). I love that this doesnu2019t look or feel cakey/heavy. I typically used loose setting powder but am happy making the switch as this feels lighter. The compact includes a u201cpuffu201d for easy application. I received this product for free in exchange for this review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This powder is an easy, quick way to set my makeup and it lasts throughout the day. It is very blurring and has a matte finish so I do add a little extra setting spray to make sure it does not look too powdery

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was also super excited to try Laura Mercieru2019s Ultra Blur Talc-Free Translucent Powder (Iu2019m always looking for a good blurring powder!) AND this was my first product gifted by BzzAgent in exchange for my honest review. Sadly it missed the mark. I have combination skin, leaning towards oily so blurring powders are essential for me! Letu2019s start with the packaging~ the box it came in was sturdy & luxurious, imagine my shock when I pulled out this cheapy plastic feeling compact!?? Recycled materials or not, you can make it better. Tbh, that was one of biggest complaints. For $52, Iu2019d expect more.   This Translucent Pressed Setting Powder looked good with ALL my makeup, It did set it and removed the shine from  my t-zone. Without makeup, terrible- looked dry and actually accentuated my fine lines, It did nothing to blur my pores and very little to blur fine lines. Didnu2019t work the best on my aging skin, however the shine absorption did last almost the entire day! (SEE PHOTO- the left side of face has powder applied only, minimal makeup).  The biggest con in my opinion is the price point & and actual compact packaging. Itu2019s a great setting powder but not worth the price in my opinion. Iu2019d recommend it if price wasnu2019t an issue.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Good for on the go. I love the Laura Mercier loose setting powders and use them often. This pressed powder is great for on the go. I like that it comes with a little poof and has a mirror in the compact. I havenu2019t thoroughly tested the waterproof claims of the product but it def helps keep the shininess at bay. I want to give it 5 stars but my skin tends to break out a bit when I use it so I gave it four stars. Itu2019s a nice powder to have for on the go and Iu2019d recommend it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have pretty dry skin and donu2019t typically care for many setting powders but this really impressed me. Itu2019s great at setting my face without making my skin look overly dry. I love how well it works to set my under eyes. It helps my concealer look great all day without creasing or budging at all. It blurs my pores well leaving my skin looking smooth all day. I love how nice the compact is and it isnu2019t messy like loose powders are. It easy and convenient to throw in my bag and touch up if needed. I really like most of the Laura Mercier products Iu2019ve tried and this one did not disappoint at all. This is definitely a product that I see myself reaching for often.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: It blurs and actually absorbs oil compared to the loose setting powder. It can be drying if you don't have a good skin prep done but I think that goes for all makeup in powder form! overall looks like a filter on skin, hides pores, 10/10!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I thought this was convenient for on the go since it has the included puff and generally gives the same effect as the loose powder. Ultimately I do prefer a loose powder because I was having a hard time getting this right where I wanted it under my eyes without applying too much and making it look cakey. I prefer just a light dusting of powder and was having a hard time getting that with this product. It was also comparable to the lasting power of my loose powder. I received this for free in exchange for an honest review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was gifted the Laura Mercier ultra blur talc-free waterproof translucent pressed setting powder in the shade u201cHoneyu201d by BzzFree and Laura Mercier in exchange for my honest review. I love Laura Mercier products and have been using their loose Translucent setting powder for quite some time. For reference, I have olive skin and have never had an issue with color matching. I was really excited to try the Laura Mercier pressed setting powder because I donu2019t like that when I use the loose setting powder, so much of it ends up being wasted. However, even though it shouldu2019ve matched up great with my skin tone, the u201cHoneyu201d color tone just makes me look yellow-orange. Itu2019s just awful- Iu2019m fairly certain that no one on earth actually has skin in that shade. Iu2019m really bummed out because I thought it would be a smash, but I honestly donu2019t think this will work well for anyoneu2019s skin tone. It DID set my makeup MAJORLY, which is the only reason it gets 2 stars from me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is a great setting powder, smells great, is very light wear and quick to use. Matches my skin tone very well and creates a nice matte finish.
Love it and would recommend. Makeup stays in place and lasts all day. Feels lightweight and my skin looks great all day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is my first Laura Mercier product ever. I was sent this powder compact in exchange for a review. Let's look at the packaging: a matte, blush-pink compact with the brand name typed across the top. A handy push button opens the lid, so it's long-nail friendly. Some of these compacts are ridiculously hard to open, but this one is easy.   The underside of the lid contains a mirror with the powder tray directly underneath. It has two little grooves on either side of the powder tray so you can stick a nail edge underneath and pop open the tray that holds the puff. The puff is a very trendy, two-finger flat puff with the brand name across the top. The very bottom of the compact has tiny holes so that loose powder falls through, I think. Or maybe to keep air circulation from allowing the puff to grow bacteria.  Let's look at the product functionality: It's supposed to make pores look smaller, presumably by filling them with tiny particles of powder (not talc). I used this compact while on a Caribbean cruise, where I knew I would be sweating and still wanted to look good. It only comes in three shades, but I donu2019t think it makes much of a difference if it doesnu2019t match your skin tone. Itu2019s extremely translucent and your real skin color comes through. It only takes a couple of swipes to mattify your face, so I think this compact is going to last a long time! While on my face, it feels silky and NOT dry. By the end of the day, I usually have powder lines from where it settled, but the Laura Mercier never got cakey.  I would recommend this product to anyone who wants to blur their pores without making it obvious they have a face full of powder.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Firstly, the packaging of this product is sleek and compact, making it convenient for travel or on-the-go touch-ups. The powder itself has a finely-milled texture that feels lightweight on the skin. It blends effortlessly into the skin, leaving a soft matte finish that helps to control shine without appearing heavy or cakey.  One of the standout features of this setting powder is its blurring effect. It helps to minimize the appearance of fine lines, pores, and imperfections, creating a smooth canvas for other makeup products. This is especially beneficial for those with oily or textured skin, as it helps to create a more flawless look.  The waterproof claim of this powder is another notable feature. It holds up well throughout the day, even in humid conditions or when exposed to moisture. This makes it a great option for those who live in hot and humid climates or for special occasions when you need your makeup to stay in place.  As for the color, the Medium Deep shade is a good match for medium to deep skin tones. It provides a subtle tint without altering the overall color of the foundation or concealer underneath. However, it would be helpful if Laura Mercier expanded the shade range to accommodate a wider range of skin tones.

reviews.review_title: A few drawbacks, but overall a great product
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received a free sample of Laura Mercier Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur in exchange for my honest opinion.  My review is based on my honest opinion.  I was excited to try this product. Upon opening the package, I had mixed feelings.  The product comes packaged in what looks like a thick compact. The outside of the compact is matte and a lighter weight than other high end cosmetic brands. The inside contained a holder for the puff which also felt light-weight.  Opening the compact, I was surprised that there was a moderate scent that I actually didn't enjoy.  The scent is difficult to describe.  It wasn't natural or consistent with other setting powders I have used or sampled in cosmetics stores. Other setting powders I have used before have either had a light powdery scent or no scent at all. I would have appreciated the same scent (or lack of scent) in this product.  After applying my daily foundation, I applied the setting powder with the included signature puff.  I didn't feel that the puff provided good coverage.  Most of the powder seemed to stick to the puff instead of applying to my face.  I switched to my regular powder brush and was more pleased with the results.  My skin looked smoother and my makeup stayed throughout the day.  I didn't notice my skin being more hydrated as the product claimed, but I don't expect hydration from a setting powder, so that wasn't really a big deal to me.   I liked that the powder was pressed.  I have never seen a pressed setting powder before.  There was no spilling or mess on my bathroom counter, which is a big benefit to me.  It is also convenient to throw in my purse and take it on the go.  The translucent honey color was a nice finish over my foundation. Despite a few drawbacks, I was pleased with this product and would recommend this to others.  The product works well and provides a smooth, matte finish to my skin that lasts all day.  I would also buy it in the future.

reviews.review_text: I already really loved the Ultra-Blur Translucent Powder and use it on the special occasions like a party or outting because I know my make up will stay but now have this pressed powder is everything. I love that itu2019s something I can easily transport. Iu2019ve always wanted a compact but never felt passionate to buy other pressed powders so this is exciting to have!

reviews.review_text: I tried the Laura Mercier Ultra-Blur Pressed Setting Powder and it exceeded all of my expectations. The blurring effect under the eyes is spectacular. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love a no make up make-up look so I tend to use dewy, sheer, barely there foundation. The problem is, I tend to be oily on my t zone area so I find that I have to use powder to minimize the shine. With the Laura Mercier Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra Blur, not only does this minimize or totally remove the shine but itu2019s also blurring my enlarged pores and some hyper-pigmented and textured areas. It doesn't feel heavy on the skin in fact it feels like Iu2019m not wearing any which is a plus on my list. My skin feels soft and the powder stays put. I dont feel the powder moving and transferring to my fingers when I touch my face which tells me this product will last for hours on your skin.   I will say though that I do feel like I could have gotten a better shade to fit my skin tone better but thatu2019s a me problem. Other than that, I absolutely love it.  For reference the left side of my face has the translucent blurring powder on while the right side doesnu2019t.  I received this product for review purposes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product for review from BzzAgent in exchange for my honest review.  This is a great product all around. Essentially the only con is the amount of product you get for the price. Pressed powders always come with less product than loose powders, but here the difference is especially egregious. The Laura Mercier loose powder comes with 20 grams for the same price. This is only 6.5 grams - a third of the product. It will get used up fast.   Aside from that, the powder delivers. I have acne prone dry skin. This works amazing at blurring the skin without making my skin look cakey or dry or settling into fine lines. I also love the puff that comes with the compact - it works well with the product. I have the honey shade, which is for medium to tan shades. I have a medium skin tone and I feel like the regular translucent shade would have worked better for me. I definitely canu2019t use the honey shade under my eyes. I recommend the honey shade if youu2019re tan or deeper.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I was so excited to receive this setting powder for free to review. It coincidentally arrived just as I ran out of my usual brand.  My first impression was that the compact was nice and minimal in appearance, however it is mildly difficult to open the powder portion. It has a strong scent I can't identify and don't particularly enjoy. The scent luckily isn't noticeable on my face like it is in the compact. The next thing I noticed is that it takes A LOT of effort to get it on a makeup brush. Better off using the poof. I have combination/oily skin so I used the powder solo to see how it looked on bare, but moisturized skin. The difference between my face with and without it was negligible. It did nothing to blur my pores and very little to blur fine lines. The shine absorption lasted only two hours. Quite a bit had to be used to achieve even that. All things considered, I do not find this setting powder to be worth the cost. Many drugstore brands outperform for a fraction of the cost. Because I used it on bare skin, rather than on to of concealer or foundation, I didn't want to totally ding it with only one star. Maybe others will have better success with this setting powder on top of other products. I do regularly use other setting powders alone for the mattifying effect.

reviews.review_title: TL;DR yes, it gives a blurred effect
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve been using this setting powder for a little less than 2 weeks now and feel like Iu2019ve finally gotten a grasp on how to properly apply it. If youu2019re starting to get fine lines and/or have dry skin, youu2019ll definitely want to be very moisturized first. reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: The Laura Mercier Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur has truly impressed me with its exceptional features and performance.  First and foremost, one of the standout qualities of this setting powder is its talc-free formula. As someone with sensitive skin, I appreciate products that prioritize skin health. The absence of talc ensures that this powder won't clog pores or cause irritation, making it suitable for all skin types.  Furthermore, the inclusion of hyaluronic acid sets this setting powder apart from others on the market. Not only does it provide a flawless finish, but it also delivers hydration to the skin, ensuring a comfortable wear throughout the day. This is especially beneficial for those with dry or dehydrated skin, as it helps to maintain moisture levels and prevent any cakey or flaky texture.  The long-wear formula of this setting powder is truly impressive, lasting for over 16 hours without the need for touch-ups. Whether you're attending a long day at work or a special event that lasts into the evening, you can trust that your makeup will stay fresh and intact.  Another convenient feature of this product is its packaging. The included puff, stored neatly underneath the powder, makes application a breeze, even when you're on the go. The compact size and built-in mirror allow for quick touch-ups throughout the day, ensuring that your makeup always looks flawless, no matter where you are.  The Laura Mercier Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur surpasses expectations on multiple fronts. From its talc-free formula and hydrating properties to its long-lasting wear and convenient packaging, it truly delivers on its promises. I wholeheartedly recommend this product to anyone in search of a setting powder that combines performance, skincare benefits, and convenience.

I absolutely love the natural, u201csoft matteu201d finish that it leaves. I also like the little puff that comes with it so that it can be used on the go. reviews.review_title: Flawless All Day: My Experience with Laura Mercie
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As I delve into the realm of Laura Mercier's Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur, I'm immediately drawn to its promises of flawless, long-lasting wear. With anticipation coursing through me, I embark on my makeup journey, eager to put this powder to the test.  Upon application, I'm greeted with a velvety texture that effortlessly glides onto my skin, instantly blurring imperfections and leaving behind a soft matte finish. The powder sets my makeup in place with precision, promising up to 16 hours of ultra-blurred wear u2013 a claim I'm excited to see unfold.  As the day progresses, I'm pleasantly surprised by the comfort it provides. Unlike other setting powders that leave my skin feeling tight and parched, this formula delivers 24-hour hydration, ensuring my skin remains nourished and comfortable throughout the day. Even my dry skin feels pampered and cared for, a rarity in the world of makeup.  What truly sets this setting powder apart is its ability to blur fine lines and wrinkles for up to 24 hours, all while maintaining a cake-free finish. My complexion looks effortlessly flawless, with no hint of cakiness or buildup in sight.  And let's not forget its photo-friendly qualities u2013 no flashback or white cast here. I can confidently pose for photos knowing that my skin looks radiant and natural, regardless of the lighting conditions.  As the hours pass by, I find solace in the fact that this setting powder is water and sweatproof, ensuring my makeup remains intact even during the most hectic moments. Plus, its dermatologist tested, non-comedogenic, and non-acnegenic formula provides peace of mind for my sensitive skin.  In conclusion, Laura Mercier's Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur has exceeded my expectations in every way possible. From its impeccable blurring capabilities to its long-lasting wear and skin-loving benefits, it's a true game-changer in the world of makeup.

reviews.review_text: I was gifted Laura Mercier Translucent Pressed Setting Powder/ Ultra Blur in exchange for my honest review and opinion. Let me begin by saying I was thrilled to try this because I've heard nothing but stellar compliments and reviews surrounding it. Upon opening, I noticed a weird, chemical-like smell. It is more like a burned, recycled plastic. I checked to make sure it wasn't the powder itself but only the container. I'm sure after some time it would. This in itself was a little off-putting. I like when powders enclose a little puff and it stays in a separate place away from the pan of powder. I'm glad there was also a mirror to see with too. This was used this on moisturized and primed skin to set my makeup.The powder is very, very dry. My face looked like the desert after using. I tried around the eyes, nose and chin/mouth area and could instantly see little lines around them and it made my skin taut looking. I tried to spritz some finishing/setting spray hoping this would help but to no avail. As far as it blurring, it may have helped a little on pores but nothing jumped out at me in the mirror. I do not see the hype for such an expensive product and will stick with my drugstore powder for a fraction of the cost. My suggestion for users would be youthful, combination/oily skin. If you have dry skin or beginning signs of aging, I would choose something else.

reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve been a licensed cosmetologist for nearly a decade and absolutely in love with makeup for twice as long! Needless to say, I was thrilled to get my hands on THE new Laura Mercier setting powder in Translucent Honey, but she broke my heart. I used the standard Laura Mercier powder puff to apply her. And let me tell you: she went on flawlessly. I looked like a real life filter in spite of my normal to dry skin. However, after just a few minutes of being outside in somewhat humid weather (not rain, just humidity), my face cracked. No joke! My better-than-life makeup cracked and caked and bunched in every unsightly area imaginable! And I had used this powder with a luxury soft-matte-finish foundation! I had never had that happen before when using that foundation, but I figured Iu2019d repeat the test with my favorite go-to foundation, which is lighter and dewier. And this time my own mild perspiration produced the same results. Unfortunately, this product does not seem to be built to survive real life. I give this product one star because of the hopeful and gorgeous beginning brought to a bitter, cakey, clumpy end.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Laura Mercier products never fail! Itu2019s almost always the first section I check at Sephora (though my collection is nearly complete). I know what to expect; itu2019s too-tier makeup for adults.  The Translucent Pressed Setting Powder blurred my skin without leaving my face dull and dry. Itu2019s lovely with tinted moisturizers on a warm day. I havenu2019t had trouble with my makeup appearing patchy or oily. There is a very mild floral scent (likely from the lilium candidum (white lily) extract. I donu2019t find it offensive, but if you are purchasing in-store, it wouldnu2019t hurt to give it a sniff, keeping in mind it isnu2019t noticeable once applied). I have the honey shade, but itu2019s truly translucent.   The container isnu2019t like typical Laura Mercier products; it is a light weight, grained plastic. There isnu2019t anything on the packaging to indicate that itu2019s from recycled materials. Regardless, it feels a bit cheap. Though there is a place under the product for the puff that is complimentary, itu2019s likely to make a mess if you travel with it for touch ups during the day. The bottom has small holes for the powder to fall out of. Since there is only 6.5 grams of product compared to the 20 grams in the medium size loose powder (which is a few dollars less or more, depending on the type), every bit is precious.   I had a difficult time rating anything from Laura Mercier only three stars, but the cheap and poorly designed packaging and having 14 grams less product than the loose powder is disappointing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This powder sets makeup like a dream! It matches to my makeup perfectly to provide a beautiful finish.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_title: Comparing the pressed to the loose
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product free in exchange for my honest review.  I have the Laura mercier translucent ultra blur loose powder and love it so I was excited to try the pressed version.   I love that the pressed version is not messy at all-something I donu2019t like about loose powders. It definitely did blur. I used the puff that it came with and rubbed excess off on the back of my hand. I still think using the puff I got too much product which after a little bit of time left my skin looking a bit more textured than it truly is.   While I do like it, Iu2019m not sure Iu2019d pay the hefty price for it when thereu2019s so many other great pressed powders for less. I also didnu2019t think the packaging was very nice feeling and for the price I think it should be nicer.   If I was to pick one over the other I definitely prefer the loose version of this powder.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product is very nice. I applied it with a brush to set my makeup and it does mattify very well. It does NOT leave a white cast and goes on very nicely, not patchy. I also used the sponge it came with, but didnu2019t like that as much as the brush. I think it would be better used for touch ups. I donu2019t see that this is reported to be non-comedogenic, but I have not experienced breakouts or clogged pores in the week that I have been using this, which is a problem I have found with many setting powders. Overall a great product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I normally am not a fan of pressed translucent powders as I find they can cake up a bit and cause the product to feel less than translucent. I do not find that issue with this one at all. The powder is so lightweight and really packs a punch. I have experimented with using this as a regular setting powder for my whole face, for setting my under eyes, and to set my concealer before applying powder foundation to prevent creasing. This setting powder does a great job all around. I do think this works like a charm to prevent creasing on smile lines or under eyes after cream products, but before other powders. It also does a great job at eliminating shine thought the day. Love it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Laura Mercier's Translucent Honey Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur  has a weightless wear formula that feels incredibly lightweight with wonderful skin breathing effects. I love the fact that it provides 16-HR of weightless wear, with an ultra-blurring, soft-matte finish, radiantly beautiful.   A talc-free setting powder that helped to blur the look of my pores, fine lines, and some imperfections.  It also contains hyaluronic acid for all-day comfort on all skin types, even dry skin.   Overall, Laura Mercier's Translucent Honey Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur is a wonderful beauty product that I love and highly recommend.

I love that the honey color is not overpowering but it is enough to help brighten a bit of my under eye and overall give my skin a softer more unified look. I use this in my under eye, around and on my nose, my forehead and around my mouth. Basically anywhere that there is a slight discoloration or hyperpigmentation and pores giving me a blurred and softer finish. I love that the product comes in a sleek and cute compact with it's own mirror and powder puff making it easy to take with you in your purse for touch ups especially if you have oily skin like I do. I can honestly say that this is now going to be my new staple setting powder.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I recently tried the Laura Mercier Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur in Medium Deep, and I have to say, I'm impressed. As someone with a medium deep skin tone, finding a setting powder that doesn't leave a white cast or alter the color of my foundation can be challenging, but this product delivered.  The powder has a silky-smooth texture that glides onto the skin effortlessly. It blurs imperfections and sets my makeup without looking cakey or heavy. I appreciate that it's translucent, so it works well with my foundation without changing its color.  One of the standout features of this powder is its ability to control shine. I have combination skin, and this powder helps to mattify my oily areas without drying out the rest of my face. It also helps my makeup stay in place throughout the day, which is a huge plus.  I should mention that I received this product for free in exchange for a review, but my opinions are honest and unbiased. Overall, I highly recommend the Laura Mercier Translucent Pressed Setting Powder Ultra-Blur in Medium Deep. It's a fantastic setting powder that caters to medium deep skin tones and delivers on its promises of a flawless finish.

reviews.review_text: This powder is great! The powder is silky, smooth, and blurs really well. The honey color blends well on my skin tone.   I used it a few ways. I did not cover any pigmentation (which isn't surprising, since it's not a foundation), but it still blurred my pores nicely.   I have dry skin, so I don't worry about oiliness during the day, but it did tamp down shine after I misted my face, so I think it would work to mattify. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: As someone with brown skin, finding the perfect pressed powder has always been a challenge, especially when considering my oily and sensitive skin. However, my search came to a delightful end with Laura Mercier's Translucent Pressed Powder in the Honey Shade.  First and foremost, the fact that it's talc-free is a huge win for me. Not only does it cater to my sensitive skin, but it also ensures a lightweight, breathable feel throughout the day. The ultra-blurring formula works wonders in minimizing pores and fine lines, providing a flawless finish that lasts for hours.  One of the standout features for me is its matte finish. Despite having oily skin, this powder keeps shine at bay without feeling heavy or cakey. Plus, it's incredibly convenient to carry around, eliminating the messiness often associated with loose powders.  What sets this product apart from others I've tried is its ability to deliver on its promises without causing breakouts. Having experienced this issue with previous brands, I was hesitant, but Laura Mercier exceeded my expectations. It's gentle on my skin, allowing me to wear makeup confidently without worrying about irritation or blemishes.  A little truly goes a long way with this product, making it not only effective but also economical. Overall, I'm thoroughly impressed with Laura Mercier's high-quality offering and would highly recommend it to anyone in search of a pressed powder that ticks all the boxes for oily, sensitive skin.  **#freeproduct**

reviews.review_text: I recently started dabbling with pressed powders and was pleasantly surprised with this one! It definitely blurred my pores a lot more than I expected! I brought this with me to my job and I only needed to touch up once, which is VERY rare for an oily girl like me.  The packaging is super cute and minimalistic - it reminds me of Rare Beauty's packaging quite a bit. Underneath the pan, there is a tiny little powder puff. I also like the fact that there are air holes underneath the puff, to keep it from storing any type of moisture and molding over.   I definitely will be reaching for this product every day now. I live in Seattle so I am not sure how this will fair in warmer weathers but it was perfect for me!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love pressed powders. I prefer them over loose ones. I was so happy to try out Laura Merciers pressed powder in Translucent Honey, I have a year long tan and so I prefer slightly tinted face powders. This powder is also blurring which I extremely appreciate! I definitely recommend if you are in the market for a new pressed powder !

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Laura Mercier's Translucent Pressed Setting Powder is a setting powder I will keep in my makeup arsenal! It helps to blur imperfections, leaving my skin looking flawless and matte, unlike others Iu2019ve tried in the past. The matte finish lasts most of the day, requiring only occasional touchups for oily skin. Its compact size makes it perfect for on-the-go use without adding extra weight to my bag. I recommend this setting powder to anyone looking for a long-lasting, flawless finish.

reviews.review_title: A staple item for makeup lovers. Pro quality

reviews.review_text: I received a free product for review.  I love the pressed powder by Laura Mercier. Itu2019s easy to use and less messy but still gets the job done without having to use too much product. Itu2019s lightweight and easy to carry, which is great for travel, etc. My fave thing about this is the blur effect..after using it the first time on cakey makeup, it fixed it and made it look good. It feels and looks like professional quality.  I found that it keeps my makeup on and in place all day or night for like 7+ hours which is great, esp for going out. Iu2019d def recommend this to anyone who wears foundation, bbc cream, concealer, etc. Itu2019s a staple product to own!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received a free sample of the Laura Mercier Ultra-Blur Talc-Free Waterproof Translucent Pressed Setting Powder in Translucent from #BzzAgent in exchange for my honest review. I've used the loose-setting powder from LM for quite some time, which I love, and this product stands up to it. It also has the perk of being used for on-the-go occasions without the mess. I struggle with large pores in my t-zone and this product completely conceals them. I would highly recommend trying this product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Packaging is great. Compact has a mirror, and a puff applicator. I put this on over the top of a tinted moisturizer and concealer. Compared to my usual powder, I would say this is definitely more blurring. Impressively lightweight. In the compact it doesn't seem like it's going to be as soft and smooth as it actually is. So far it has not settled into the fine lines around my eyes. It's also not drying. I have dry skin and it feels very comfortable. My only slight complaint is that I wish the puff was tear-drop shaped instead of round.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin

reviews.review_text: I just recently received this product and I can already honestly say I absolutely adore this! It's such Hugh quality, even the packaging is nice! The little compact this comes in is very sleek and great for travel. I've been using this every morning as a part of my routine and I love that it doesn't feel heavy or icky on my face. I highly reccomend this. I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: For full disclosure, I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest review.  Ah. This packaging is so simple, but itu2019s stunning. Absolutely stunning. Very well made and practical. This is a perfect product to come along with you during your day to day activities or while traveling. I doubt youu2019re going to need it for a touch up, but if you do - it wonu2019t let you down!  Laura Mercier is known for having the most amazing formula for setting powder. This one lived up to the reputation. This is probably the best setting powder Iu2019ve ever used, and Iu2019ve tried quite a few over the years.  The formula is immaculate and very easy to use. Not much product is needed to get the job done. And get the job done, it is. Instantly transforms the appearance of your skin, creating the most beautiful blur while setting your makeup into place.  If youu2019re in the market for a setting powder that isnu2019t going to let you down and last you a while, this is the clear contender.

reviews.review_text: A solid pressed powder! Used it over my concealer and foundation and it was light enough to blend well but not feel cakey. Didn't love the pad it came with for application so I used a brush instead.
